p: In addition, a retrospective analysis conducted by Chunqin Long et al. showed that the sensitivity of CT examinations was 97.2% (35/36 patients were positive) at presentation, whereas the sensitivity of initial rRT-PCR was 84.6% (30/36 patients were positive). In the second rRT-PCR round, three patients had a positive result, and the other three were positive in the third round of rRT-PCR [ 15]. These findings indicate, among others, that rRT-PCR should be repeated to avoid misdiagnosis.
